meanings.def: great respect for somebody
examples: the guest of honor (= the most important one)
the seat/place of honor (= given to the most important guest)
They stood in silence as a mark of honor to her.
do honor to somebody/something This biography does great honor to the poet's achievements.

meanings.def: something that you are very pleased or proud to do because people are showing you great respect
examples: It was a great honor to be invited here today.
It was my honor and privilege to be Helen's friend.
It is a great honor to represent my country at the Olympics.

meanings.def: the quality of knowing and doing what is morally right
examples: a man of honor
a sense of honor
Proving his innocence has become a matter of honor.

meanings.def: a good reputation; respect from other people
examples: upholding the honor of your country
The family honor is at stake.

meanings.def: a person or thing that causes others to respect and admire something/somebody
examples: She is an honor to the profession.

meanings.def: an award, official title, etc. given to somebody as a reward for something that they have done
examples: to win the highest honor
She received nearly every honor bestowed upon a poet.
He was buried with full military honors (= with a special military service as a sign of respect).
He wears his scars like badges of honor (= rewards that you can see).

meanings.def: a university course that is of a higher level than a basic course (in the US also used to describe a class in school that is at a higher level than other classes)
examples: an honors degree/course
a First Class Honors degree
(North American English) I took an honors class in English.

meanings.def: if you pass an exam or graduate from a university or school with honors, you receive a special grade for having achieved a very high standard
a title of respect used when talking to or about a judge or a US mayor
examples: No more questions, Your Honor.

meanings.def: the cards that have the highest value
to do something to make somebody feel very proud and pleased
examples: Would you do me the honor of dining with me?

meanings.def: to perform a social duty or ceremony, such as pouring drinks, making a speech, etc.
examples: Would you do the honors and draw the winning ticket?

meanings.def: to be given the opportunity to do something that makes you feel proud and happy
examples: May I have the honor of the next dance?
She had the honor of being the first living artist to have her work exhibited in the Louvre.
I had the rare honor of being allowed into the artist's studio.
Max was given the dubious honor (= it may not really have made him feel proud and happy) of organizing the children's party.

meanings.def: used to say that even criminals have standards of behaviour that they respect
to feel that you must do something because of your sense of moral duty
examples: He felt honor-bound to help her.

meanings.def: no particular person, team, etc. is doing better than the others in a competition, an argument, etc.
in order to show great respect for somebody/something
examples: a ceremony in honor of those killed in the explosion
A banquet was held in her honor.

meanings.def: used to promise very seriously that you will do something or that something is true
examples: I swear on my honor that I knew nothing about this.

meanings.def: to be trusted to do something
examples: You're on your honor not to go into my room.

meanings.def: a thing that somebody considers to be very important for their honour or reputation

meanings.def: to do something that shows great respect for somebody/something
examples: honor somebody It was a simple ceremony to honor the Goddess of water.
our honored guests
honor somebody with something The President honored us with a personal visit.
(ironic) I'm glad to see that you've decided to honor us with your presence!
Actors and musicians gathered to honor McGrath's memory with a performance of his work.

meanings.def: to give public praise, an award or a title to somebody for something they have done
examples: be honored She has never been properly honored in her own country.
be honored (with something) (for something) He has been honored with an award for his charity work.
honor somebody/something (by doing something) The town has honored his bravery by erecting a memorial.

meanings.def: to do what you have agreed or promised to do
examples: I have every intention of honoring our contract.
She is determined to honor her husband's dying wish.
They have failed to honor the peace agreement.

meanings.def: to feel proud and happy
examples: I was honored to have been mentioned in his speech.
‘Would you be my best man?’ ‘I'd be honored.’
I was honored to have been mentioned in his speech.
‘Would you be my best man?’ ‘I'd be honored.’
